summary: Pseudoscorpions are tiny arachnids that look like scorpions but are not true scorpions. They are helpful to humans as they eat pests like moth larvae and ants. These creatures are found in various places but are often hard to spot due to their small size. People sometimes confuse them with ticks or spiders. Pseudoscorpions sometimes hitchhike on other animals, a behavior called phoresis.
title: Pseudoscorpion
